title: Independent Bloc (Bosnia and Herzegovina)
text:
The Independent Bloc (, abbreviated NB/НБ) is a <a href="centrist">centrist</a> and <a href="conservative">conservative</a> <a href="List%20of%20political%20parties%20in%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">political party</a> in <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>. Its current leader is <a href="Senad%20%C5%A0epi%C4%87">Senad Šepić</a>.
History.
The Independent Bloc was founded in 2017 after three <a href="Party%20of%20Democratic%20Action">SDA</a> members of the <a href="House%20of%20Representatives%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">House of Representatives</a>, <a href="Senad%20%C5%A0epi%C4%87">Senad Šepić</a>, Sadik Ahmetović and Salko Sokolović, received warnings from SDA's president <a href="Bakir%20Izetbegovi%C4%87">Bakir Izetbegović</a> that they will be removed from the party because they voted against increasing excise taxes for petroleum and petroleum products. Not willing to vote on the excise taxes SDA removed Šepić and gave a "penalty card" to the other two. Not long after all of them left the party and formed the delegates club of the Independent Bloc which would soon after become a separate political party.
